utils
Class DataMgr

java.lang.Object
  utils.DataMgr
public class DataMgr
extends java.lang.Object

The class acts as an I/O Manager class for saving and loading data for complex objects in the library such as Graph, HGraph, and properties Hashtable objects. The class is thread-safe (reentrant).

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

getUniqueId

public static long getUniqueId()
return a globally unique identifier, in a thread-safe manner.

Returns:
long

readPropsFromFile

public static java.util.Hashtable readPropsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
In case key is the keyword class, the key value is the next token in the line, and the object to be constructed together with its string arguments is given in the rest of the line In case key is the keyword rndgen, the RndUtil class's seed is populated with the value of this line (long int). The seed does not need to be stored in the Hashtable returned. Also, if a 3rd argument is provided, it indicates the number of distinct threads to require access to RndUtil, and thus it sets the required extra instances of Random objects needed. file format is key,value[,classname][,opts] [...] Empty lines and lines starting with # are ignored.

Parameters:
filename - String
Returns:
Hashtable
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readVectorsFromFile

public static java.util.Vector readVectorsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented as a vector representation of a vector in a vector space of dimension totaldimensions. If a pair does not appear for a vector, the value for this coordinate is assumed zero.

Parameters:
filename - String
Returns:
Vector Vector
Throws:
IOException, - ClustererException
java.io.IOException

readSparseVectorsFEFromFile

public static java.util.Vector readSparseVectorsFEFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented using full storage requirements (as a normal double[]) taking up a lot of space, but also maintaining an index of the non-zero positions for very fast getQuick(i) and getIthNonnZeroPos(i) operations.

Returns:

readCentersFromFile

public static java.util.Vector readCentersFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
read a set of center vectors from a file. The first line contains the number of dimensions of the vector space. The rest of the lines are the centers in space separated coordinates.

readGraphFromFile2

public static Graph readGraphFromFile2(java.lang.String filename)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       GraphException
filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes starta enda [weighta] [...] [weight_node1...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is double (non-negative) node weights after arcs listing, if they exist, are double (non-negative)

Parameters:

Returns:
Graph

readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile

public static HGraph readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              GraphException
filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes [1] [weighta] node1 node2 ... nodek [...] ] The nodei are in [1...numnodes] weighta is int (non-negative). If it does not exist (the third value in the first line does not exist), then its value is 1.

Parameters:
filename - String
Returns:
HGraph
Throws:
java.io.IOException
GraphException

writeGraphToFile

public static void writeGraphToFile(Graph g,
                                    java.lang.String filename)
                             throws java.io.IOException
takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is as follows: numnodes numarcs ... starta enda weight starta, enda are in [0,...,numnodes-1]

Parameters:
g - Graph
filename - String
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeGraphToFile2

public static void writeGraphToFile2(Graph g,
                                     java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException
takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is as follows: numarcs numnodes ... starta enda weight ... nodeweight ... starta, enda are in [1,...,numnodes] nodeweight are double values, the first corresponds to the 1st node etc.

Parameters:
g - Graph
filename - String
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                                       java.lang.String filename)
